CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM

These are the names of the materials used in the study, specifically the names of the conjugated copolymers and the blend film.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here's the updated list of Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM

The mention of "annealed" and "unannealed" conditions in the paragraph does not refer to material names, but rather to the state of the material (i.e., whether it has been subjected to annealing or not). Therefore, these entities can be removed from the list.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the list of Material Name entities in the paragraph presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

These entities are relevant to the material property of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film, specifically its surface properties and how they change under different conditions.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in the same words as in the original text:

| annealing temperature |
